item.title: Introduction
Basic Types
item.description: Strings str := "Hello" Multiline string str := `Multiline string` Numbers Typical types num := 3 // int num := 3. // float64 num := 3 + 4i // complex128 num := byte('a') // byte (alias for uint8) Other Types var u uint = 7 // uint (unsigned) var p float32 = 22.7 // 32-bit float Arrays // var numbers [5]int numbers := [.

item.title: Flow Control
item.description: Condition if day == "sunday" || day == "saturday" { rest() } else if day == "monday" && isTired() { groan() } else { work() } if _, err := doThing(); err != nil { fmt.Println("Uh oh") Switch switch day { case "sunday": // cases don't "fall through" by default! fallthrough case "saturday": rest() default: work() } Loop for count := 0; count <= 10; count++ { fmt.

item.title: Bash Variables
item.description: Variable NAME="John" echo $NAME echo "$NAME" echo "${NAME} Condition if [[ -z "$string" ]]; then echo "String is empty" elif [[ -n "$string" ]]; then echo "String is not empty" fi
